Regulation Name(s): Device to detect and measure non-microbial analyte(s) in human clinical specimens to aid in assessment of patients with suspected sepsis
Document Summary: FDA 510(k) summary for MeMed BV immunoassay system measuring TRAIL, IP-10, and CRP to differentiate bacterial vs viral infection in suspected acute cases
Indications for Use Summary: Aids in differentiating bacterial from viral infection in adult and pediatric patients presenting with suspected acute infection (≤7 days symptoms) using semi-quantitative measurement of TRAIL, IP-10, and CRP from serum, for use in emergency or urgent care settings at hospital admission, alongside other clinical and laboratory findings.
